My mobile operator has a PDF bill link, but the PDF is generated by a script called InvoiceDownload.axd. (Because of bug 345148, Firefox doesn't offer to open the file in a PDF reader, but that's not this bug.)

When I save this file, even though it's a PDF, Firefox saves the file with the name InvoiceDownload.axd. When I double-click on this file, OS X has no idea what to do with it; I have to rename it to InvoiceDownload.pdf for it to be opened with a PDF reader.

Opera, for example, overrides the .axd extension and substitutes .pdf. Also fine would be appending .pdf, leaving InvoiceDownload.axd.pdf. As it is, I can't open my bills without going through several steps.

I believe we do this on Windows, but not on Mac and Linux because the claim was that on those OSes the extension is not what's used to determine file handling, when the relevant code was written...

If that claim is now false (which it seems to be), then we should indeed use the Windows code more broadly.
